name: Create database, user & assign user privileges.txt - Create Database
description: This section explains how to create a new database in PostgreSQL, a popular open-source relational database management system. The command 'CREATE DATABASE blah;' is used to create a new database named 'blah' within the PostgreSQL server. This is a fundamental step in setting up a database environment for storing and managing data.
use_cases: Creating a new database for a new application or project
Setting up a separate database for testing or development purposes
Provisioning a database for a specific user or group
Organizing data into separate databases for better management and security

description: This section explains how to create a new user in PostgreSQL and grant that user full privileges (permissions) to access and manage a specific database.
